metadata.title: CVE-2022-48995 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:Input: raydium_ts_i2c - fix memory leak in raydium_i2c_send()There is a kmemleak when test the raydium_i2c_ts with bpf mock device:  unreferenced object 0xffff88812d3675a0 (size 8):    comm "python3", pid 349, jiffies 4294741067 (age 95.695s)    hex dump (first 8 bytes):      11 0e 10 c0 01 00 04 00                          ........    backtrace:      [<0000000068427125>] __kmalloc+0x46/0x1b0      [<0000000090180f91>] raydium_i2c_send+0xd4/0x2bf [raydium_i2c_ts]      [<000000006e631aee>] raydium_i2c_initialize.cold+0xbc/0x3e4[raydium_i2c_ts]      [<00000000dc6fcf38>] raydium_i2c_probe+0x3cd/0x6bc [raydium_i2c_ts]      [<00000000a310de16>] i2c_device_probe+0x651/0x680      [<00000000f5a96bf3>] really_probe+0x17c/0x3f0      [<00000000096ba499>] __driver_probe_device+0xe3/0x170      [<00000000c5acb4d9>] driver_probe_device+0x49/0x120      [<00000000264fe082>] __device_attach_driver+0xf7/0x150      [<00000000f919423c>] bus_for_each_drv+0x114/0x180      [<00000000e067feca>] __device_attach+0x1e5/0x2d0      [<0000000054301fc2>] bus_probe_device+0x126/0x140      [<00000000aad93b22>] device_add+0x810/0x1130      [<00000000c086a53f>] i2c_new_client_device+0x352/0x4e0      [<000000003c2c248c>] of_i2c_register_device+0xf1/0x110      [<00000000ffec4177>] of_i2c_notify+0x100/0x160  unreferenced object 0xffff88812d3675c8 (size 8):    comm "python3", pid 349, jiffies 4294741070 (age 95.692s)    hex dump (first 8 bytes):      22 00 36 2d 81 88 ff ff                          ".6-....    backtrace:      [<0000000068427125>] __kmalloc+0x46/0x1b0      [<0000000090180f91>] raydium_i2c_send+0xd4/0x2bf [raydium_i2c_ts]      [<000000001d5c9620>] raydium_i2c_initialize.cold+0x223/0x3e4[raydium_i2c_ts]      [<00000000dc6fcf38>] raydium_i2c_probe+0x3cd/0x6bc [raydium_i2c_ts]      [<00000000a310de16>] i2c_device_probe+0x651/0x680      [<00000000f5a96bf3>] really_probe+0x17c/0x3f0      [<00000000096ba499>] __driver_probe_device+0xe3/0x170      [<00000000c5acb4d9>] driver_probe_device+0x49/0x120      [<00000000264fe082>] __device_attach_driver+0xf7/0x150      [<00000000f919423c>] bus_for_each_drv+0x114/0x180      [<00000000e067feca>] __device_attach+0x1e5/0x2d0      [<0000000054301fc2>] bus_probe_device+0x126/0x140      [<00000000aad93b22>] device_add+0x810/0x1130      [<00000000c086a53f>] i2c_new_client_device+0x352/0x4e0      [<000000003c2c248c>] of_i2c_register_device+0xf1/0x110      [<00000000ffec4177>] of_i2c_notify+0x100/0x160After BANK_SWITCH command from i2c BUS, no matter success or errorhappened, the tx_buf should be freed.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-48995` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.13.0-16-generic - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-4.13.0-16-generic-lpae - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-4.13.0-16-lowlatency - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-extra-4.13.0-16-generic - 4.13.0-16.19
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-37-generic - 5.4.0-37.41~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-37-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-37.41~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-37-lowlatency - 5.4.0-37.41~18.04.1

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-37-lowlatency - 5.4.0-37.41~18.04.1
No subscription required

No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1011-fips - 4.15.0-1011.12

Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-16.19').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-37.41~18.04.1').
linux-kvm package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1002.2').
